description.narrative: (Tanzania): The Tushiriki Pamoja ("Participating Together") activity advances U.S. Government security objectives that reinforce and strengthen democratic governance by increasing: 1) citizen engagement and oversight of political and electoral processes, particularly for women and youth, that includes domestic monitoring of electoral processes; 2) representation in a multi-party political system, primarily through strengthening internal political party governance structures and specifically increasing the inclusion of women, youth, and people with disabilities in leadership and decision-making positions; and 3) transparency in election administration. With FY 2020 funds, Tushiriki Pamoja will advocate for targeted electoral reforms through the Ushiriki Tanzania Coalition; develop policy recommendations on defined advocacy issues; use social media for advocacy and online tools for organizing peer-to-peer coaching. There will be sub-awards to selected coalition members to conduct specific advocacy tasks and engage with election stakeholders, youth and women caucuses in parliament, and the Office of the Registrar of Political Parties. With FY 2020 funds, the activity will support local organizations and networks to undertake advocacy efforts around recommendations or outcomes of domestic election observation efforts, as well as civic and voter education initiatives, and bolster the capacity of civil society organizations to engage in advocacy and technical processes. Tushiriki Pamoja will engage with a range of political parties; support improved internal governance and conflict resolution structures; greater inclusion of marginalized groups (including women, youth, and people with disabilities); and improved professionalism related to strategic planning, campaign management, and platform development. .

participating-org.narrative: Consortium for Elections and Political Process Strengthening
